Dear Ms. Sears:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on (date). Due
to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and MISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not
obtained and maintained compliance for rules found in repeat
noncompliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(f) If the employee has criminal convictions, the chief
administrator or his or her designee shall complete a written
evaluation of the convictions that addresses the nature of the
conviction, the length of time since the conviction, and the
relationship of the conviction to regulated activity.
In one of eight new employee records reviewed the record did
not show a written assessment from the agency related to the
employee’s 2016 conviction.
Technical assistance-R400.12212(2)(g)
The agency was apprised the statement from the employee
shall contain greater detail related to the conviction incident and
area of growth for the employee since the conviction.
R 400.12306 Application request.
(3) An agency shall document that a person who has met the
requirements of subrule (1) of this rule has received an
application and information regarding all of the following:
(a) A copy of the act.
(b) Administrative rules for foster homes.
(c) Administrative rules for child placing agencies.
(d) Good moral character rules.
(e) The child protection law.
(f) The children's ombudsman act.
Two of six open foster home records reviewed did not show
documentation that the items listed in (a)-(f) had been provided
to the applicant.
R400.12312 Foster parent training.
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have training
in and maintain a current certification in first aid from the
American Heart Association or the American Red Cross or other
institution approved by the department.
4

One of six open foster home records received did not show a
current first aid certification after 12/19/2019.
R400.12324 Reevaluation.
(1) An agency shall conduct an annual on-site visit and
complete a written reevaluation of a foster home.
One of six open foster home records reviewed showed the
foster home’s 2/1/2021-1/31/2022 reevaluation was completed
late on 3/27/2022.
R400.12324 Reevaluation.
(2) The annual reevaluation shall include a determination and
assessment of all of the following:
(b)Family functioning and interrelationships as determined by
observation of, and interviews with, each member of the
household and each social service worker who has had children
placed in the home during the last licensing period.
In one of six open foster home records reviewed the
reevaluation did not show documentation of interviews with
workers who had children placed in the home during the
licensing period
R400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(a)Prior approval from the certifying agency authorizing the
placement of a child in the home.
(b)Documentation that the foster parent is willing to accept the
foster child.
One of six open foster home records reviewed did not show
documentation of (a) and (b) as required by the rule.
R400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(c)A copy of the initial evaluation with written endorsement by
the borrowing agency that the evaluation is acceptable.
(d) A copy of the current reevaluation with written endorsement
by the borrowing agency that the evaluation is acceptable.
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received orientation
to the policies of the borrowing agency.
5

Three of six open foster home records reviewed did not show
documentation of (c), (d), and (f) as required by the rule.
R400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services worker
that has children placed in the home.
Two of six open foster home records reviewed did not show
documentation of(c) as required by the rule.
R400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement.
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up to the
time of the change in placement and need that remain to be
met.
(b) Provision for any continuing services.
One of four closed foster child records reviewed did not show
documentation of (a) and (b) as required by the rule. The
information was left blank on the action summary.
R400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
(a):
One of three initial service plans (ISP) reviewed was nine days
late.
Repeat Violation- Interim 12/11/2019.
(b):
One of 25 updated service plans (USP) reviewed was two days
late.
R400.12419 Initial service plans.
(1) The initial service plan, as required in R 400.12418(2)(a),
shall include all of the following information:
6

(c) Assessment of the placement selection criteria as
required under R 400.12404 (4).
One of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show
documentation of (c) as required by the rule.
R400.12502 Program statement.
(2) An agency shall give a copy of the program statement to a
youth before placement in independent living.
One of three open independent living youth records reviewed
did not show documentation that the youth was provided a copy
of the program statement before or at placement.
R400.12503 Policy and procedures.
(3) An agency shall provide a youth in independent living with a
copy of the agency’s policies and procedures required by this
rule.
One of three open independent living youth records reviewed
did not show documentation that the youth was provided a copy
of the agency’s policy and procedures.
R400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(2) All of the following shall be in the case record before a youth
is placed in independent living
(a) How the youth meets the eligibility requirements for the
specific program the youth is being placed into.
Two of three open independent living youth records reviewed
did not show documentation of (a). A Casey Life Skill
Assessment or another assessment utilized for this purpose
was not document.
R400.12510 Independent living contract.
(1) There shall be a mutually agreed upon contract between the
youth and agency specifying all of the following:
(a) The responsibilities of the agency and youth.
One of three open independent living youth records reviewed
did not show documentation of an initial contract with the youth.
7

R400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth and
social service worker. The contract shall be reviewed and
updated at least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
One of three open independent living youth records reviewed
did not show documentation of an updated September or
December 2021 contract.
R400.12607 Agency recommendation.
(4) An agency shall provide the applicants for adoption with a
signed and dated copy of the evaluation and recommendation
upon its completion.
Three of four approved adoptive family records reviewed did not

 Two did not show documentation that the adoptive family

7/22/2021 adoption assessment upon its completion.
 A third showed the family’s 7/13/2021 adoption
assessment was not provided timely, per the 8/27/2021
documented verifiable date.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.19 (5) (c) Assessments and Service Plans, Content (commitment 69).
Service plans shall be signed by the caseworker, the
caseworker's supervisor, the parent(s}, and the child(ren),
if of age to participate. If the parent(s) or child(ren) or both
are not available or decline to sign the plan, the service
plan shall include an explanation of the steps taken to
involve them and shall identify any follow-up actions to be
taken to secure their participation in services.

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note

Closing documentation.

FOM 722-6B Family team meeting.
FTMs should include child welfare staff, parents, caretakers,
foster parents, children, youth, and may also include extended
family, friends, neighbors, community-based service providers,
community representatives, tribal representatives, for Indian
children, or other professionals involved with the family.
Each meeting must be documented in MiSACWIS using the
FTM hyperlink and all of the appropriate forms must be
completed for each type of meeting
Certain circumstances, events, and/or stages of case
progression mandate FTMs must occur within the required time
frames as out lined in the following table.

FOM 722-8D Treatment plans.
Agreement and Signature:
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must obtain
signatures from the following individuals, as applicable:
10

 Foster parents, relative caregivers, and unrelated court
ordered caregivers.
The caseworker must obtain signatures from all applicable
individuals and upload the signatures pages into the electronic
case record within 30 days of the report date.
Five of 28 service plans reviewed did not show compliance:
 One child’s 9/2/2021-11/30/2021 treatment plan was
signed by the caregiver but not dated, and it could not be
discerned if it was signed timely.
 A second child’s 6/4/2021-9/1/2021 treatment plan was

 A third child’s 9/18/2021-12/18/2021 treatment plan was

Repeat Violation-Renewal 12/14/2020, cited under 722-8C.
FOM 722-8E Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary.
The caseworker must complete the DHS-69, Foster
Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary, and upload to
MiSACWIS within the timeframe required for the specified
change.
 Within three business days of foster care or juvenile
justice program case closure.
One of four closed foster child records reviewed did not show
documentation of a DHS-69 for the child’s 7/26/2021 case
closure.
FOM 801-03 Medical passport.
Updated Medical Passport:
All medical information within the medical passport must be
current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child's
current and complete health information.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
 Participating legal parents, if the child is a temporary
court ward; Quarterly, while in out-of-home placement;
and at reunification.
 The child’s foster care provider: At or prior to each
placement and quarterly.
11

Four of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show
consistent documentation that the medical passport was
completed quarterly and provided to the caregiver.
One of three independent living youth records reviewed did not
show documentation a medical passport was completed for
September and December 2021.
Contract-IL+ Independent Living-Plus Contract 2.10.d.4) b.
Within 30-calendar days of intake provide the youths Life Skill
Coach a copy of the youth’s Independent Living Plus (ILP) plan
and contract, which includes areas of need related to the
independent living skills.
In two of three independent living youth records reviewed where
the youth was documented as an ILP youth, the record did not
show documentation of the information required by the
standard.
Contract IL + Independent Living-Plus Contract 2.10.d.9)
Independent living Instruction
A minimum of 4 hours per week of IL instruction upon
completion of the CLSA and IL plan and contract. Seventy-five
percent of the IL instruction time per month must be practical
hands-on instruction as opposed to classroom, worksheet, or
online instruction. In addition, 10% of the Il instruction must be
community based.
In two of three independent living youth records reviewed where
the youth was documented as an IL-plus youth, the record did
not show documentation of the number of IL instruction hours as
required by the standard.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
R400.12212(2)(d) Personnel records.
 The agency shall ensure that all employee references are dated so as to
determine they were received prior to the date of hire.
FOM 722-6h Quality visitation documentation
 The agency was apprised it shall ensure that social work contacts of home
visits consistently include what happened at the home visit in more detail,
inclusive of what interaction and engagement occurred with the caregiver
and child.
12

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.12326(1)(c) (d) Borrowed home.
 The agency was advised the licensing supervisor’s legible and dated
signature on the certifying agency’s initial evaluation and reevaluation is
an acceptable illustration of the agency’s endorsement of these
evaluations.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The first corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2021 Renewal inspection
completed 12/16/2021 where it received the following rule violations:
 R400.12324(2)(d) Reevaluation.
 R400.12405(3)(a)-(j) Change of placement.
 SRM 200-Security Awareness Training.
 Policy-FOM 802 Mental health screening.
 Policy-FOM-08C Parent Agency Treatment Plan Agreement.
 Policy-ADM-400 MARE registration.
 Policy-ADM-330 Quarterly adoption progress report.
The agency was very successful with this correction action plan. It received only one
repeat violation this inspection as indicated in this report.
The second corrective action plan related to special investigation 2021C04201051
initiated 9/21/2021, where the agency received a citation for R400.12503(2)(h) Policy
and procedures related to medical, dental, and mental health care. The agency
submitted an acceptable corrective action plan; and it has completed that corrective
action plan, which indicated a plan to establish a policy related to medication inventory
and disposal; and to train staff on it all. Per review of staff training, the medication
policy/ procedure, medication inventory and the one discharge form where this issue
related, the agency is incompliance with this corrective action.
DCWL ANALYST ISSUES ADDRESSED:
There were no safety alerts this inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
